title: 114_s3245
content: The Act may be cited as the "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" and supports clinical nurse specialists. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 811 of the Public Health Service Act to include authorized clinical nurse specialist programs that provide education for registered nurses to effectively care for patients with acute and chronic illness. The "Title VIII Nursing Workforce Reauthorization Act of 2016" supports clinical nurse specialists by amending Section 801 of the Public Health Service Act to define nurse-managed health clinics and expanding the National Advisory Council on Nurse Education and Practice to include clinical nurse specialists. Reauthorization of funding for nursing programs under Section 3. Amendments are made to various sections of the Public Health Service Act, including loan repayment programs, nurse faculty loan program, comprehensive geriatric education, and funding for nursing programs. Additionally, changes are made to nurse education, practice, quality, and retention grants under Section 831. Amendments are made to promote career advancement for nursing personnel in various training settings, including cross-training among diverse population groups. This includes advancing individuals to become professional nurses, licensed practical nurses, certified nurse assistants, and home health aides. Additionally, individuals can progress from diploma or associate degree nurses to baccalaureate prepared registered nurses or advanced education nurses to meet the needs of the registered nurse workforce. Amendments include developing internships and residency programs with nursing schools to encourage mentoring and specialty development. Subsection (g) is revised to include nurse-managed health clinics. Subsection (h) is removed.
